ingles: Again he began teaching beside the sea, and a very large crowd gathered near him. So he went aboard a boat and sat in it away from the shore, but the whole crowd was next to the sea, along the shore.
portugues: Ele começou novamente a ensinar à beira do mar, e uma multidão muito grande se reuniu perto dele. Então ele entrou num barco e se sentou, e ficou a certa distância da margem, mas toda a multidão estava em terra, à beira do mar.

ingles: And he began to teach them many things with illustrations, and while he was teaching, he said to them:
portugues: E ele começou a ensinar-lhes muitas coisas com ilustrações. Ensinava-lhes dizendo:

ingles: "Listen. Look! The sower went out to sow.
portugues: "Escutem: O semeador saiu para semear.

ingles: As he was sowing, some seeds fell alongside the road, and the birds came and ate them up.
portugues: Ao passo que semeava, algumas sementes caíram à beira da estrada, e vieram as aves e as comeram.

ingles: Others fell on rocky ground where there was not much soil, and they immediately sprang up because the soil was not deep.
portugues: Outras caíram em solo rochoso, onde não havia muita terra, e brotaram imediatamente porque o solo não era profundo.

ingles: But when the sun rose, they were scorched, and they withered because they had no root.
portugues: Mas, quando o sol se levantou, ficaram queimadas e murcharam, porque não tinham raiz.

ingles: Other seeds fell among the thorns, and the thorns came up and choked them, and they yielded no fruit.
portugues: Outras sementes caíram entre os espinhos, e os espinhos cresceram e as sufocaram, e elas não deram fruto.

ingles: But others fell on the fine soil, and growing up and increasing, they began to yield fruit, and they were bearing 30, 60, and
portugues: Mas outras caíram em solo bom e, depois de brotar e crescer, começaram a dar fruto; e produziram 30,

ingles: times more."
portugues: e

ingles: Then he added: "Let the one who has ears to listen, listen."
portugues: vezes mais."

ingles: Now when he was alone, those around him with the Twelve began questioning him about the illustrations.
portugues: Ele acrescentou então: "Quem tem ouvidos para escutar, escute."

ingles: He said to them: "To you the sacred secret of the Kingdom of God has been given, but to those outside all things are in illustrations,
portugues: Então, quando ficou sozinho, os que estavam em volta dele vieram com os Doze e começaram a lhe perguntar sobre as ilustrações.

ingles: so that, though looking, they may look and still not see, and though hearing, they may hear and still not get the sense of it; nor will they ever turn back and receive forgiveness."
portugues: Ele lhes disse: "A vocês foi dado o segredo sagrado do Reino de Deus, mas para os de fora tudo é apresentado em ilustrações,

ingles: Further, he said to them: "You do not know this illustration, so how will you understand all the other illustrations?
portugues: para que eles olhem, mas ainda assim não vejam, e ouçam, mas ainda assim não compreendam; e eles jamais darão meia-volta e receberão perdão."

ingles: "The sower sows the word.
portugues: Além disso, ele lhes disse: "Vocês não compreendem essa ilustração; portanto, como entenderão todas as outras ilustrações?

ingles: These, then, are the ones alongside the road where the word is sown; but as soon as they have heard it, Satan comes and takes away the word that was sown in them.
portugues: "O semeador semeia a palavra.

ingles: Likewise, these are the ones sown on rocky ground; as soon as they have heard the word, they accept it with joy.
portugues: Então, aquelas sementes à beira da estrada, onde se semeia a palavra, representam os que ouvem a palavra, mas logo vem Satanás e tira a palavra que foi semeada neles.

ingles: Yet they have no root in themselves, but they continue for a time; then as soon as tribulation or persecution arises because of the word, they are stumbled.
portugues: Do mesmo modo, aquelas semeadas em solo rochoso representam os que ouvem a palavra e logo a aceitam com alegria.

ingles: There are still others that are sown among the thorns. These are the ones who have heard the word,
portugues: Contudo, não têm raiz em si mesmos, mas continuam por algum tempo; então, assim que surge dificuldade ou perseguição por causa da palavra, tropeçam.

ingles: but the anxieties of this system of things and the deceptive power of riches and the desires for everything else make inroads and choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.
portugues: Ainda há outras que são semeadas entre os espinhos. Essas representam os que ouvem a palavra,

ingles: Finally, the ones that were sown on the fine soil are those who listen to the word and favorably receive it and bear fruit-30, 60, and
portugues: mas as ansiedades deste mundo, o poder enganoso das riquezas e os desejos de todas as outras coisas interferem e sufocam a palavra, e ela se torna infrutífera.

ingles: times more."
portugues: Finalmente, aquelas que foram semeadas em solo bom representam os que escutam a palavra, a aceitam e dão fruto: 30,

ingles: He also said to them: "A lamp is not brought out to be put under a basket or under a bed, is it? Is it not brought out to be put on a lampstand?
portugues: e

ingles: For there is nothing hidden that will not be exposed; nothing is carefully concealed that will not come out in the open.
portugues: vezes mais."

ingles: Whoever has ears to listen, let him listen."
portugues: Disse-lhes também: "Será que se pega uma lâmpada para colocá-la debaixo de um cesto ou debaixo de uma cama? Não é para colocá-la em cima de um suporte?

ingles: He further said to them: "Pay attention to what you are hearing. With the measure that you are measuring out, you will have it measured out to you, yes, you will have more added to you.
portugues: Pois não há nada escondido que não venha a ser exposto; nada cuidadosamente oculto que não venha à tona.

ingles: For whoever has will have more given to him, but whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him."
portugues: Escute quem tem ouvidos para escutar."

ingles: So he went on to say: "In this way the Kingdom of God is just as when a man casts seeds on the ground.
portugues: Disse-lhes ainda: "Prestem atenção ao que estão ouvindo. A mesma medida com que vocês medem será usada com vocês, e mais lhes será acrescentado.

ingles: He sleeps at night and rises up by day, and the seeds sprout and grow tall-just how, he does not know.
portugues: Pois àquele que tem, mais será dado; mas daquele que não tem, até mesmo o que tem será tirado."

ingles: On its own the ground bears fruit gradually, first the stalk, then the head, finally the full grain in the head.
portugues: Assim, acrescentou: "Portanto, o Reino de Deus é como quando um homem lança sementes no solo.

ingles: But as soon as the crop permits it, he thrusts in the sickle, because the harvesttime has come."
portugues: Ele dorme à noite e se levanta de dia, e as sementes brotam e crescem alto, embora ele não saiba exatamente como.

ingles: And he went on to say: "With what can we compare the Kingdom of God, or with what illustration can we explain it?
portugues: O solo, por si mesmo, dá fruto aos poucos: primeiro a haste, depois a espiga, e finalmente o grão maduro na espiga.

ingles: It is like a mustard grain, which at the time it was sown in the ground was the tiniest of all the seeds on the earth.
portugues: Mas, assim que os grãos ficam maduros, ele passa a foice, porque chegou o tempo da colheita."

ingles: But when it has been sown, it grows and becomes greater than all other vegetable plants and produces great branches, so that the birds of heaven are able to find lodging under its shadow."
portugues: E acrescentou: "A que podemos comparar o Reino de Deus, ou com que ilustração podemos explicá-lo?

ingles: With many illustrations of that sort he spoke the word to them, to the extent that they were able to listen.
portugues: É semelhante a um grão de mostarda que, quando é semeado no solo, é a menor de todas as sementes da terra.

ingles: Indeed, without an illustration he would not speak to them, but he would explain all things privately to his disciples.
portugues: Mas, depois de semeado, cresce e se torna maior do que todas as outras hortaliças e produz grandes ramos, de modo que as aves do céu podem achar abrigo sob a sua sombra."

ingles: And on that day, when evening had fallen, he said to them: "Let us cross to the other shore."
portugues: Com muitas ilustrações desse tipo, ele lhes falava a palavra, até onde eram capazes de entender.

ingles: So after they had dismissed the crowd, they took him in the boat, just as he was, and there were other boats with him.
portugues: Realmente, nada lhes falava sem ilustração, mas explicava tudo em particular aos seus discípulos.

ingles: Now a great violent windstorm broke out, and the waves kept crashing into the boat, so that the boat was close to being swamped.
portugues: E naquele dia, ao cair a noite, ele lhes disse: "Passemos para a outra margem."

ingles: But he was in the stern, sleeping on the pillow. So they woke him up and said to him: "Teacher, do you not care that we are about to perish?"
portugues: Assim, depois de terem dispensado a multidão, eles o levaram, assim como estava, no barco; e havia outros barcos com ele.

ingles: With that he got up and rebuked the wind and said to the sea: "Hush! Be quiet!" And the wind abated, and a great calm set in.
portugues: Levantou-se então uma violenta tempestade, e as ondas se lançavam sobre o barco, de modo que o barco estava ficando inundado.

ingles: So he said to them: "Why are you so afraid? Do you not yet have any faith?"
portugues: Mas ele estava na popa, dormindo sobre o travesseiro. Assim, eles o acordaram e lhe disseram: "Instrutor, o senhor não se importa que estejamos prestes a morrer?"

ingles: But they felt an unusual fear, and they said to one another: "Who really is this? Even the wind and the sea obey him."
portugues: Com isso ele se levantou, censurou o vento e disse ao mar: "Silêncio! Cale-se!" E o vento parou, e houve uma grande calmaria.
